title: Install OO Containerized (on-premises)
content:
Operations Orchestration (OO) embedded in Design and Deploy (DND) has been removed. You must migrate from OO embedded in DND to OO Containerized before you can use the DND capability. 

OO Containerized is a capability that enables seamless automation and orchestration of repeatable IT operations across teams, tools, and environments. When installing OO Containerized you will get OO Central with an Internal OO Remote Action Service (RAS). The internal OO RAS is deployed automatically for each OO Central tenant in a tight coupling framework during the tenant deployment process. 

Additionally, you can install the following components depending on your requirements.

  • External RAS - To achieve high availability of RASes, you can install an external RAS apart from the internal RAS available upon installation of OO Containerized. 
  • OO Workflow Designer - OO Workflow Designer is a web-based environment for authoring flows, which is available as a standalone product that can be deployed either on a Windows or Linux server. Flows are authored in the CloudSlang language and run in OO Central. 

You can run a script so that the OPB download center in the Service Management UI displays direct download links for OO RAS and OO Workflow Designer. See Enable direct download of OO RAS and OO Workflow Designer from the Service Management UI.

For more information, see Install OO RAS and Install OO Workflow Designer. 

Together, the components of OO enable you to manage various services and devices across the organization and their lifecycle.

The installation of OO Containerized is mandatory for DND capability. 

The following table contains a summary of  instructions for installing Operations Orchestration (OO) containerized on on-premises

Topic Description
Plan Review the required resources and create a deployment plan for the installation of OO
  1. Review Plan the deployment
  2. Review System requirements
Prepare and deploy Prepare the required resources for the installation of OO:
  1. Download OO charts package
  2. Download OO container images
  3. Upload OO container images to a registry
  4. Create a new deployment for OO
  5. Create NFS volumes for OO
  6. Prepare persistent volumes for OO
  7. Prepare external database for OO
  8. Get connection details for connecting to the Service Management IdM
  9. Create OO integration admin user in the Service Management IdM
  10. Generate sensitive data for OO
  11. Create my-values.yaml for OO
  12. Install OO Containerized on-premises
  13. Verify OO installation
Post-installation tasks
  1. Deploy OO Containerized capability in Suite Administration
  2. Configure OO menu visibility
  3. Assign Autopass access to users
  4. Manage OO license
  5. Configure OO - DND integration (This step is applicable only if you have installed DND capability.)
  6. Install additional OO components
  7. Configure orchestration settings (This step is applicable only if you are using external OO RAS.)
Uninstall
  1. Uninstall OO
Install additional OO Components
  1. Install an External OO RAS
  2. Install an OO Workflow Designer
